title: 111_hr3169
content: SECTION 1. LAKE PONTCHARTRAIN, LOUISIANA. The Secretary of the Army is authorized to construct a pumping station in Hoey's Basin to evacuate storm water, as described in a specific report. The project authorized under this Act involves constructing permanent pumps and canal modifications at 17th Street, Orleans Avenue, and London Avenue Canals, with a total cost of $205,000,000. The Federal share of the cost will be in accordance with specific laws related to emergency appropriations. The project involves constructing permanent pumps and canal modifications at 17th Street, Orleans Avenue, and London Avenue Canals, with a total cost of $205,000,000. This is authorized by various laws including the Flood Control Act of 1965 and the Water Resources Development Act of 2007. The term "project report" refers to a report submitted by the Secretary to Congress in response to specific requirements. The U.S. Troop Readiness, Veterans' Care, Katrina Recovery, and Iraq Accountability Appropriations Act, 2007 serves as the basis for complying with project requirements and modifications to the 17th Street, Orleans Avenue, and London Avenue canals in New Orleans. The Secretary of the Army is responsible for conducting a study and submitting a report to Congress. The Secretary of the Army must analyze residual risks and conduct an independent peer review of concept designs and cost estimates for various options. A report must be submitted to the House and Senate Appropriations Committees within 180 days of the Act's enactment, detailing the study results. The project report should identify the most technically advantageous and operationally effective option for reducing flooding risks in the New Orleans area in the long term. This option should increase overall drainage capacity and reduce local flooding. Effective upon submission of the report, the Secretary will resume project implementation based on the selected option for reducing flooding risks in New Orleans, prioritizing system flexibility and long-term reliability.
